Also, there are a lot of references to movies and games, as well as secrets and optional paths. Really cool!

My only complaint is that the network screen at some point becomes very "polluted". I got some program that allowed some customization on that screen by doing some optional missions, but still it was messy.

185701721.review:
[h3]⏰ Kamienie milowe[/h3]
[list]
	[*][b]🏁 10 godz.[/b] - ukończenie gry (81% osiągnięć)
	[*][b]💯 14 godz.[/b] - 100% osiągnięć
	[*][b]💎 19 godz.[/b] - ukończenie DLC „Labyrinths”
[/list]
Po ukończeniu gry skorzystałem z poradnika do zidentyfikowania 2 osiągnięć.

[h3]🏆 Osiągnięcia[/h3]
[list]
	[*][b]Poziom trudności:[/b] łatwy
	[*][b]Osiągnięcia możliwe do przeoczenia:[/b] 2 (Rude, /el Sec Champion) 
	[*][b]Osiągnięcia online:[/b] brak
	[*][b]Wymagane płatne DLC:[/b] nie
	[*][b]Minimalna liczba przejść:[/b] 1
[/list]
Zdobycie 100% osiągnięć wymaga odkrycia pełnej zawartości gry, chociaż kilka zadań można pominąć. Nie trzeba też hakować każdego komputera.

Osiągnięcia są ciekawe i ich odblokowywanie daje satysfakcję. Zdobycie jednego z nich wymaga wczucia się w rolę w ponadprzeciętny sposób.

[h3]📜 Charakterystyka[/h3]
[list]
	[*] Dobrze zbudowany klimat, wysoka skuteczność immersji
	[*] Rosnący poziom trudności w miarę postępu w rozgrywce
	[*] Świetny dodatek „Labyrinths” z historią lepszą niż w podstawce
	[*] Brak języka polskiego, konieczna znajomość wspieranego języka w stopniu średnio-zaawansowanym
[/list]

[h3]🐞 Napotkane błędy[/h3]
[olist]
	[*] Chcąc odblokować [spoiler]misje /el (ukryta ścieżka)[/spoiler] trzeba ukraść program znajdujący się na komputerze [spoiler]użytkownika Naix[/spoiler], nawet jeżeli już się go posiada.
[/olist]

185672265.review: (10/10) Love this game. I learned UNIX and had headache for one entire week. And no, I do not use Arch, I use Kubuntu 😂🤣👍🏻

185582483.review:
Fun little hacking game. 

It has a few flaws: Firstly, notes taking up RAM, let alone a lot of RAM. I sort of get what the devs were going for here, but all it does is encourage the player to pull  up a notepad on their second monitor, especially in the endgame when you need to juggle passwords and IP addresses for upwards of a dozen machines. Secondly, the node map. It's a cool concept but its insanely cluttered and unusable, to the point where the DLC gives you a way to sort it, so the devs know its a problem. but you just have to deal with it until you beat the dlc (intended to be played late in the main story)

Beyond those flaws though, it's a very good little hacking game. The terminal setup is cool, the story is surprisingly compelling, and it's got a neat series of puzzles that are very intuitive, even for me as someone without a background in cyber security. Recommended, just, take your own notes.

На самом деле, лично для меня, этот проект стал крайне приятной неожиданностью. 
Купил по сумасшедшей скидке на какой-то распродаже. Но игра приятно удивила, пусть я и не сразу разобрался с регистром и с командами по типу UNIX, но со временем быстро вник. Сюжет не столь сильный, но всё же приятный и даже интересный. Дизайн стилей можно спокойно находить на других машинах, и удобно менять, что тоже является плюсом. Минусом будет, пожалуй, однообразие миссий для продвижения по сюжету, и их частичная простота.
Советую попробовать.

185440833.review:
Hacknet is a cyberpunk-themed hacking simulation game that places players in the role of a hacker tasked with completing various digital missions. Dive into the world of computer systems, uncover secrets, and navigate a web of challenges in a realistic and immersive experience. The game blends puzzle-solving, strategy, and a deep narrative to keep players engaged.

[b]Key Features:[/b]

[b]Hacking Simulation:[/b] Hacknet offers a unique and authentic hacking experience, where players utilize a variety of commands and tools to infiltrate systems. The realistic simulation of a hacker's environment adds an extra layer of depth and immersion.

[b]Narrative-Driven Gameplay:[/b] The game features an engaging story where players uncover a conspiracy as they hack into various systems. The narrative unfolds through emails and logs, enhancing the sense of mystery and intrigue as the player progresses.

[b]Puzzle-Solving Mechanics:[/b] Each mission in Hacknet presents complex puzzles that require players to think critically and use their skills. The puzzles become progressively more challenging, adding a sense of accomplishment upon completion.

[b]Cyberpunk Atmosphere:[/b] Hacknet captures the essence of a cyberpunk world, with its gritty visuals and electronic soundscape. The game's aesthetic is minimalistic but effective, contributing to the overall tension and immersion.

[b]Realistic Hacking Tools:[/b] Players are equipped with a variety of hacking tools and software that mimic real-world techniques. The need to learn and adapt to new tools and strategies is a key aspect of the gameplay.

[b]Time-Sensitive Missions:[/b] Players must act quickly to complete missions before their actions are detected. This adds an element of urgency and excitement to the gameplay, pushing players to work efficiently under pressure.

[b]Conclusion:[/b] Hacknet stands out as an immersive and engaging hacking simulation game that captures the essence of a cyberpunk world. Its narrative, puzzle-solving mechanics, and realistic hacking tools provide a captivating experience for players who enjoy strategy, problem-solving, and an atmospheric gaming environment. The game's unique approach to hacking and its strong narrative make it a memorable experience in the cyberpunk genre.

[spoiler] it was very useful to me [/spoiler]

185306270.review:
Pretty good.  The story and music are great, and the exploration loop of finding IP addresses and looking through files is well put together.  Most of the challenges are very easy though.

Some of the controls and mission triggers are really janky and broken.  For example, there is a mission where you get counter-hacked, and there are effectively 3 paths you can choose between, but the triggers for the non-main path are notoriously broken (there are endless results of people not unlocking it after meeting all the conditions if you search online).

The terminal also does not handle directory paths all that robustly.  For example, if you are in `/home` on a server and click `/log`, the game automatically issues the commands `cd ..` and `cd log`, but often these are done too quickly and the second command fails, so you don't always go to the directory you clicked on.  Similarly, if you have an exe in /home and want to move it to /bin, you can't do `mv foo.exe /bin/`, you have to do `mv foo.exe ../bin/`.

But most of the time the clunky edges of the controls don't really get in the way, and overall it is a fun game.

I would definitely recommend Exapunks to anyone who is interested in this game or enjoyed it.  Exapunks is another hacking themed game with puzzles that actually use a basic form of programming, so the puzzles are more interesting imo

ps，一个瑕疵，虽然里面IRC的log挺搞笑的。但基本上都是恶俗男/搞笑男的调侃和恶臭刻板印象和歧视梗（尤其那个说自己是女权女然后去男生宿舍楼下要求性服务的……什么幻想），作为女性计算机行业从业者，对大部分聊天并不会感到会心一笑，每次点开belike“我为什么要手贱点进去”。还是希望制作者能够更多地考虑到这个行业也存在相当一部分女性。不过这是个2012年的游戏，现在马后炮也没什么用，只能希望之后的类似游戏能够考虑到这方面吧~

184876292.review:
This is one of those games that stands the test of time despite being nearly 10 years old.

I think when compared to games of around this era of the mid 2010s it's hard not to see it as a hidden gem that didn't really succumb to the wishes and whims of the public, which could be chalked up to Hacknet not being as popular as Goat simulator, meaning that the need for Matt to add redundant stuff that detracted from the original game and its initial vision is practically nonexistent anyway. But still, coming back to this after years and years of just forgetting that it exists is a real treat.

I know it's a bit unfair to compare Hacknet to effectively a Unity engine sh%tpost but either way I'm glad that Matt Trobiani didn't just milk this game for all it's worth like the devs of Goat Simulator did. It sucks to see when games end up like that. Looking at you KSP 2... (and also FNAF holy sh%t that series got messy... scott you should've just ended it at three.)

As for Hacknet though i say it's worth every minute even if you can just blast through it in about six hours. The music, the vibes, the visuals, and even the additional challenges you can pose to yourself after going through the base game and/or labyrinths. (for example, breaking into the email servers and seeing what you can find, it is possible!)

Either way, i do recommend Hacknet not just for newcomers to the game but also for people returning to it. Give it a few years and remember that it exists, a game fading into obscurity isn't really a bad thing, just means that you can just return to it after a while and enjoy it for the memories you've had with it on your first playthrough. (That is of course if the game is even available and is properly archived and isn't lost to time. *COUGH, COUGH* UBISOFT.)

184784773.review:
Really cool and interesting take on just the concept of a game in general. Great soundtrack and overall a fun time. 
I was surprised by how intense the game got on multiple occasions given it being in such a limited visual format. I guess that just goes to show the dev's talent with stressing you out.
The Labyrinths dlc is great, too. It's a whole extra storyline with a great sense of challenge and storytelling that I think improves on the base gameplay a lot.
The main storyline and the dlc took me only a little over 12 hours to beat, so it's not a huge dedication, but I will admit I needed some help from a walkthrough on a good few occasions. This game is teeming with secrets and easter eggs too, so I'd highly recommend replaying it to try and find those early on.

184419869.review:
Super fun game. As someone who has basic knowledge into network/cybersecurity and has worked with UNIX terminals before it's immediately comfortable. I'm a bit of a slow learner but I found my rhythm relatively quickly. It does take a bit to get into the groove, I didn't find myself truly enjoying it until I was out of the tutorial and could choose my own missions and it felt more like a job than a learning obligation. Very interesting game design and it felt like more or less a perfect crossroads between simulating the complexity of the technology at hand (even though Naix was right- you're more or less just a script kiddie) and being a cool xD L33T H4XX0R game. 

Spoiler: [spoiler] My favorite mission was the pacemaker one. It gave you a background and a lead and basically said "alright, figure it out". It was a super surreal experience testing out a couple things to see if it would stop the heart and when my 3rd try actually worked I felt the real weight of a life on my hands. In contrast, the last lengthy mission with V to uncover Bit's past and everything was cool but it felt like I was getting handheld through the process and it was really annoying having to re-do some hacks (because I had missed some things and had to go back or wanted to double-check one of Bit's many servers) and suddenly encountering "unhackable" places. I didn't mind the slight shift to having to sleuth for passwords but it didn't come at the right time imo. [/spoiler]

A couple issues- the node map quickly gets crowded around the end of the game (and isn't really meaningfully sorted), meaning it gets a little annoying to find what you need. When you get to around the last couple missions when you have to visit a lot of nodes it gets kinda cumbersome. This is compounded by the fact that you sometimes have to re-hack nodes if you want to revisit them in case you missed something. Double backing to "double check" a machine already isn't a super pleasant feeling, so if you're digging through a cluster of nodes to find it, just to have to re-execute what could be a pretty lengthy hack just gets kind of frustrating. If there were better organization of nodes or an option to dim the brightness/opacity of nodes I don't really care about at the moment, it would be great. In addition, the graphics are a little messed up. De-selecting fullscreen makes the display expand greater than my monitor size (even though the game resolution matches my monitor resolution).

Otherwise- very fun game. Short length, about 5-8 hours to complete depending on your pace and experience on a terminal. Had a nice time spending my NYE on this one. Cheers!

184365968.review: Это какой-то хоррор, громкость при получении новых адресов, и резкий звук 4 раза заставил меня дёрнуться, и последний раз был последним

184363952.review: Nice little game! I liked the puzzles and the story line :)

184335123.review:
作为普通人角度：
太有意思了，真TM好玩啊，我是黑客！！！哈哈哈哈

专业角度：
1.游戏以简单Linux指令与图形相结合的方式，体现出其游戏核心内容，渗透。
2.游戏虽然没有网上传的这么夸张，什么玩了就能成黑客这么离谱，但作为一款黑客游戏，在渗透操作方面的流程精炼却不简洁的体现出来，是很难得的！
3.现实中渗透测试，会先在网上信息搜集，锁定其常用设备，利用nmap等主机扫描工具对其进行指纹提取，具体再用kali等渗透集成工具进行常规渗透，游戏没有将这些繁杂步骤罗列出，反而更能让游玩者有更强的游戏体验，与黑入别人设备的爽感，不错！！！
4.游戏不用过多网络安全基础，但要有初中英语及以上水平储备最好，当然，大部分以中文为主，英语实在不好也影响不大，用下翻译软件就行，不影响游玩体验
5.游戏以主线和各支线穿插推进为主，剧情丰富，不是无脑渗透，而是根据提示以及游戏中获取的各种工具，解密，推理，找寻线索，而且每次新剧情不重复，所以让人越玩越上瘾！！！

总结：好玩，无需网络基础就可以玩，对于培养网络安全兴趣有帮助（但还没达到成黑客标准），推荐！！！

184110111.review:
好玩

1. 本体与其说是一个剧情冒险/解密游戏，更像一个枯燥无味的模拟器游戏。但是不得不说，他将黑客、网络攻防形象化的介绍了出来。
2. 这个游戏不好玩的地方在于，无非是用工具攻克，然后检索信息，很重复。
3. 但是dlc的剧情尤其是聊天系统的引入，npc的互动，以及更多网络攻防信息的介绍，无疑给游戏拔高了好几个高度。
4. 这个游戏存在一些非线性流程导致的bug，反正我是没玩上北极星之首背后ip的终极试炼。。。
以及没有成功反击Naix那个小兔崽子，都以为交了任务导致重新回去游戏系统无法触发流程。

183982908.review: By far the best hacking game I have seen here with some "meta" elements added to it. This game is just as fun even if you don't have a background in cyber security. 10/5 stars

183951404.review: great game, and one of a kind for sure. i do think this is a great game for people that like the hacking type games such as grey hat. this does teach you basic linix terminal commands which i think i a nice touch. overall great game.

183788437.review: Script kiddie simulator, I love it

183728418.review:
Hacknet ist ein spannendes und erfrischend anderes Hacking-Spiel, das dich in die Rolle eines virtuellen Hackers versetzt. Die Benutzeroberfläche ist minimalistisch, aber super atmosphärisch, und die Mechaniken fühlen sich authentisch an, ohne zu überfordern. Besonders cool ist die Story, die dich Schritt für Schritt tiefer in eine packende Cyberwelt zieht.

Das Spiel erfordert Konzentration und logisches Denken, was es besonders für Tüftler interessant macht. Gelegentlich kann es allerdings etwas repetitiv wirken, vor allem, wenn man längere Zeit an bestimmten Aufgaben festhängt. Trotzdem bleibt es ein außergewöhnliches Erlebnis, das dich wie ein echter Hacker fühlen lässt.

Für alle, die auf ungewöhnliche Simulationen und Technik stehen, ein Muss! Von mir gibt’s eine starke 8/10 – spannend, fordernd und einfach cool gemacht!

183709259.review: As minimalistic as the UI for the game is, it sure as hell is immersive. It's got a simple, yet fantastic story, and the gameplay is complete seamless. Everytime I play this game I sink in 10 hours to finish the entire game in 1 sitting because I am so immersed.

183687707.review:
前阵子因为机缘巧合要用 Mac 打开这游戏，结果不知道为什么运行一段时间后游戏会崩……被整破防了，吐个槽

[h3][x]游戏真得会崩[/h3]
之前 Windows 上毫无障碍，后来 Mac 就有问题了……写评论后补充：看别的评价表示其他平台也可能崩，我暂时没遇到过
[h3][x]玩法很单一，缺乏游戏深度[/h3]
从头到尾，玩家只作为纯粹的调用方，使用一堆已经写好的程序。随着剧情推进，会获得另一堆已经写好的程序，然而也没有什么本质区别。不管什么服务器，都不需要主动发现缺陷做针对破解，只要按顺序执行拥有的程序。
有点解谜因素，但也就是看邮件然后在终端里找找找就是了。简单并且不同关换汤不换药。
[h3][x]不能配置终端，画面单端，看久了眼睛容易疲劳[/h3]
我认为既然不是社工式的骇入，那么总该可以给本机套个舒服点的 UI 吧。可惜换不得，游戏原皮看得有点累。
[h3][-]原声不对胃口，个人觉得有点吵闹[/h3]
游戏的 BGM，主要就是陪伴玩家骇（干）入（活）用的，与剧情推进、渲染氛围之类的基本无关。因人而异吧，只是我干活时不爱听这种风格的音乐。

[hr][/hr]
吐槽游戏玩法的过程中，我甚至产生了一种既视感，它好像换皮的模拟经营游戏（
比如如果是要开餐厅：
[list]
    [*]需要按顺序调用程序工具 -- 需要按顺序加材料做菜
    [*]有限的时间窗口和内存资源 -- 有限的时间窗口和厨房资源
    [*]终端内解密和获得新程序 -- 口味刁钻但会给新菜谱的谜语人美食家
[/list]
